projects.title: near.dev
projects.summary: The NEAR Developer Network was designed to provide a resource-rich and community-oriented experience to engage and support a growing developer ecosystem.
projects.overview:
Exploring, onboarding to, and building on a new technology platform comes with a whole host of challenges for new and experienced developers alike. Regardless of the framework or platform, software developers considering the use of a new technology for their own applications often share a set of distinct needs:

  1. Ways to effectively evaluate existing applications of a technology in order to judge its potential.
  2. Practical avenues for hands-on learning to help them adapt to the essential developer experience.
  3. High-quality developer tools and resources aimed at accelerating development, inspiring new ideas, and reducing the need to reinvent the wheel.
  4. Reliable and responsive support for when they inevitably encounter challenges throughout their development journey.

These insights inspired the team at Pagoda to design a new resource-rich and community-oriented experience to engage and support the developers of the NEAR Protocol ecosystem as they sought to innovate on top of its cutting-edge decentralized application development platform.

projects.title: kit
projects.summary: Building on the success of the platform's first web-based crypto wallet, Kit aimed to offer a more secure and refined user experience to the users of NEAR Protocol.
projects.overview:
Before the official launch of the NEAR Protocol in 2020, the team at NEAR Inc. spent the year prior preparing the first NEAR Wallet for use on the live network.

With a focus on simplicity and accessibility, NEAR Wallet was designed to be accessible via web browsers, and facilitated the creation of millions of NEAR accounts during its lifespan, as well as activities critical to the network such as token staking and delegation.

As the platform matured and looked for ways to decentralize ownership of its core infrastructure, it explored a rebrand and spin-out of the NEAR Wallet product from the core protocol team.

Kit was conceptualized, prototyped and planned as an evolution of NEARâ€™s flagship crypto wallet, offering a greater degree of security via its implementation as a browser extension, and a more refined user experience.

projects.title: fora
projects.summary: As an evolution of the Bounties Network, fora would be a center for community-driven initiatives, decentralized collaboration, and incentivized action.
projects.overview:
The Bounties Network was one of the first projects built on the Ethereum platform to formally experiment with crypto incentives to drive community engagement, explore new ways for individuals to earn for their contributions, and to help project owners source talent from an emerging decentralized workforce.

After a series of successful experiments in partnership with projects like UNICEF Innovation, the team at Bounties Network looked to evolve the platform from a white-label testing environment into a fully fledged community platform where people from all over the web could share about their initiatives, collaborate, incentivize action, and earn for their participation. This next evolution was fora.
